description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Advancing Universal Health Coverage (AUHC) activity provides quality services for maternal and child health, family planning, nutrition, and TB treatment and control, while ensuring financial protection and access for the poor. Through this Activity, USAID is transforming the Smiling Sun clinics, managed earlier by 25 different NGOs, into a unified, not-for-profit social enterprise company called Surjer Hashi Network (SHN). A key USAID priority will be to support quality improvement of health services, expand service delivery options, increase network efficiency through standardization and optimization of service outlets and introduce an affordable pricing strategy for the SHN network. USAID assistance will also support improvement of SHN's financial management system, health management information system and the commodities and logistics management system. This activity will work on developing other income generation opportunities and creating diversified funding sources through innovative partnerships with the private sector and GOB service providers.With FY 2020 funds, AUHC will support over one million antenatal care contacts, ensure skilled birth attendance for about 10,000 pregnant women, provide essential newborn care to over 100,000 newborns, and treat over 50,000 children with pneumonia. AUHC will expand and strengthen TB screening and treatment services in 45 clinics, introduce new GeneXpert machines in up to three clinics, and use community service providers and satellite clinics for active case-finding and treatment. AUHC will also provide nutrition counseling during antenatal and postpartum maternal and child health visits.The activity will promote self-reliance by mobilizing domestic resources and will support the U.S. National Security Strategy Pillar IV, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved health status in Bangladesh.
